meanings.definition: A person or thing that allures or entices.
meanings.sent1: The allurers in the store window caught my attention with their bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The allurers at the carnival enticed visitors with their games and prizes.
meanings.sent3: The allurers in the advertisement made the product seem irresistible.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an allurers, drawing people in with its warmth and charm.
meanings.sent5: The allurers of the mysterious treasure map led the adventurers on an exciting journey.

meanings.definition: The act of alluring or enticing.
meanings.sent1: The allurers of the magician's tricks captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The allurers of the movie trailer made everyone eager to see the film.
meanings.sent3: The allurers of the dessert table tempted me to try every treat.
meanings.sent4: The allurers of the music festival beckoned people from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The allurers of the enchanted forest lured travelers off the beaten path.
